simple

Class HelloWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.HelloWorld

  • public class HelloWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    Sample Hello World topology application. This Java application builds a simple topology that prints Hello World to standard output.
    The application implements the typical pattern of code that declares a topology followed by submission of the topology to a Streams context (@code com.ibm.streamsx.topology.context.StreamsContext}.
    This demonstrates the mechanics of declaring a topology and executing it.

    If no arguments are provided then the topology is executed in embedded mode, within this JVM.
    This may be executed as (from the samples/java/functional directory ) as:

    • ant run.helloworld - Using Apache Ant, this will run in embedded mode.
    • java -jar funcsamples.jar:../com.ibm.streamsx.topology/lib/com.ibm.streamsx.topology.jar:$STREAMS_INSTALL/lib/com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.jar simple.HelloWorld - Run directly from the command line in embedded mode.
    • java -jar funcsamples.jar:../com.ibm.streamsx.topology/lib/com.ibm.streamsx.topology.jar:$STREAMS_INSTALL/lib/com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.jar simple.HelloWorld CONTEXT_TYPE - Run directly from the command line with a specific StreamsContext where CONTEXT_TYPE is one of:
      • DISTRIBUTED - Run as an IBM InfoSphere Streams distributed application.
      • STANDALONE - Run as an IBM InfoSphere Streams standalone application.
      • EMBEDDED - Run embedded within this JVM.
      • BUNDLE - Create an IBM InfoSphere Streams application bundle.
      • TOOLKIT - Create an IBM InfoSphere Streams application toolkit.
    • An application execution within your IDE once you set the class path to include the correct jars.
